javacsw.services.cs.core

Class JBlockingConfigManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • javacsw.services.cs.core.JBlockingConfigManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, IBlockingConfigManager, scala.Equals, scala.Product
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JBlockingConfigServiceClient

    public class JBlockingConfigManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IBlockingConfigManager, scala.Product, scala.Serializable
    A blocking Java API for the config service.

      • create

        public ConfigId create(java.io.File path,
                       ConfigData configData,
                       java.lang.Boolean oversize,
                       java.lang.String comment)
        Description copied from interface: IBlockingConfigManager
        Creates a config file with the given path and data and optional comment. An IOException is thrown if the file already exists.
        Specified by:
        create in interface IBlockingConfigManager
        Parameters:
        path - the config file path
        configData - the contents of the file
        oversize - true if the file is large and requires special handling (external storage)
        comment - a comment to associate with this file
        Returns:
        a unique id that can be used to refer to the file

                       ConfigData configData,
                       java.lang.String comment)
        Description copied from interface: IBlockingConfigManager
        Updates the config file with the given path and data and optional comment. An FileNotFoundException is thrown if the file does not exists.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        path - the config file path
        configData - the contents of the file

        a unique id that can be used to refer to the file

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        path - the configuration path
        id - id used to specify a specific version to fetch (default: latest)
        Returns:

      • get

        public java.util.Optional<IBlockingConfigData> get(java.io.File path,
                                                   java.util.Date date)
        Description copied from interface: IBlockingConfigManager
        /** Gets the file as it existed on the given date. If date is before the file was created, the initial version is returned. If date is after the last change, the most recent version is returned. If the path does not exist in the repo, an empty value is returned.
        Specified by:
        get in interface IBlockingConfigManager
        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        date - the target date
        Returns:
        an object that can be used to access the file's data, if found

      • setDefault

        public void setDefault(java.io.File path,
                       java.util.Optional<ConfigId> id)
        Sets the "default version" of the file with the given path. If this method is not called, the default version will always be the latest version. After calling this method, the version with the given Id will be the default.

        Specified by:
        setDefault in interface IBlockingConfigManager
        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        id - an optional id used to specify a specific version (by default the id of the latest version is used)

      • resetDefault

        public void resetDefault(java.io.File path)
        Resets the "default version" of the file with the given path to be always the latest version.

        Specified by:
        resetDefault in interface IBlockingConfigManager
        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root

      • getDefault

        public java.util.Optional<ConfigData> getDefault(java.io.File path)
        Gets and returns the default version of the file stored under the given path. If no default was set, this returns the latest version.

        Specified by:
        getDefault in interface IBlockingConfigManager
        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        Returns:
        an object that can be used to access the file's data, if found
